subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (3/6). Senegal's historic city will be largely underwater by the end of the 21st century. Several thousand fishermen have already left their homes on the beach for a stifling dormitory town.

Northern Haiti is the country's showcase for tourists, but gang violence in Port-au-Prince is crippling activity
subhead: The Cap-Haïtien region boasts many world-renowned historic sites. Yet foreign visitors have become increasingly scarce in what is known as the country's 'tourism capital,' as Haiti faces a deep political and security crisis.

title: 'Pessimism has taken hold in a once-optimistic China'
subhead: China's economy is now advancing with difficulty. In his column, journalist Harold Thibault describes a civil society increasingly prone to doubt after the stop-and-go approach of the authoritarian policies enacted by Xi Jinping.

title: 'The Smashing Machine' is a deeply tender film about one champion's vulnerabilities
subhead: Benny Safdie has made his solo directorial debut by empathetically recounting the story of an American wrestling champion overcome by doubt and addiction.

title: How Airbnb made France its favorite destination, with more than one million listings
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (1/6). In 15 years, the platform has established itself in France, the leading tourist destination, thanks to effective lobbying and favorable tax conditions. It has even worsened the housing crisis. The company is now expanding its offerings to continue its growth.
byline: By Véronique Chocron and Jessica Gourdon

Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: Zohran Mamdani leads New York mayoral race, rattling Democratic establishment
subhead: A week before the vote, the self-proclaimed socialist leads the polls after a savvy campaign on the cost of living. But his stance to the left of the party unsettles even his own camp, while questions linger over the funding of his social platform.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)
